## Description {#details}

Defines the llvm::Arg class for parsed arguments.

<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Append the argument onto the given array as strings.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Append the argument, render as an input, onto the given</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// array as strings.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The distinction is that some options only render their values</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// when rendered as a input (e.g., Xlinker).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return a formatted version of the argument and its values, for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// diagnostics. Since this is for diagnostics, if this Arg was produced</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// through an alias, this returns the string representation of the alias</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// that the user wrote.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::string <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/opt/arg/#a63bdece47c81d3a6e63de19cb824b788">getAsString</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/opt/arglist">ArgList</a> &amp;Args) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
